SEARCH
Package io.fluxcapacitor.javaclient.tracking.handling.authentication

Annotation Interface RequiresAnyRole

@Documented @Target({TYPE,CONSTRUCTOR,METHOD,ANNOTATION_TYPE,PACKAGE}) @Retention(RUNTIME) @Inherited public @interface RequiresAnyRole
Declares role-based access control for message handlers or payload types.

When placed on a handler method, class, or package, the @RequiresAnyRole annotation restricts invocation of that handler to users possessing at least one of the specified roles. If the current user (or the user associated with the incoming message) lacks a matching role, the handler is silently skipped. This allows other eligible handlers to take over, enabling flexible delegation.

In contrast, if this annotation is present on the payload class itself, and the user lacks a required role, message handling will be actively blocked and an UnauthorizedException is thrown.

This annotation supports meta-annotations. It can be applied to a custom annotation that expresses roles using an enum or another abstraction, allowing more structured or type-safe role definitions.

Example (on handler method):


 @HandleCommand
 @RequiresAnyRole({"admin", "editor"})
 void handle(UpdateArticle command) {}

Example (on payload class):


 @RequiresAnyRole("admin")
 public record DeleteAccount(String userId) {}

Meta-annotation usage (with enum roles):


 @RequiresAnyRole
 @Target({ElementType.TYPE, ElementType.METHOD})
 public @interface RequiresRole {
     Role[] value();
 }

  • Optional Element Summary

    Optional Elements
    Modifier and Type
    Optional Element
    Description
    String[]
    value
    One or more role names (case-sensitive) that grant access.

  • Element Details

    • value

      String[] value
      One or more role names (case-sensitive) that grant access. At least one of the listed roles must be held by the user for access to be granted.
      Default:
      {}
